(Wow, a lot of stuff to clear up.  The movie was released in 1986 and was a 
failure, odd considering Transformers' popularity.  Two swear words, oh, boo 
hoo.  I swear way more when I'm talking to my teachers.  And in the normal 
version of the movie there's only Ultra Magnus swearing, not Spike which was 
cut from theatres.  Also after the first week scenes of the Decepticons 
torturing Ultra Magnus on a rack to get the Matrix were cut out because 
parents bitc...errr...complained.

The Matrix wasn't destroyed, yadda yadda, even if there aren't many planets 
with robots on 'em they'd be happy about saving their planet and afts.  The 
leader after Rodimus Prime (gay rip off of Optimus) was... ::drum roll:: 
Optimus Prime!  After he'd been revived by Quintessons, for the second time.  
Don't believe me?  Watch the two parter episode titled "Return of Optimus 
Prime".  Fortress Maximus was never leader of the Autobots.  In the last 
episode of Transformers, "Rebirth" (a really crappy five part commercial), 
Fortress Maximus was only then built, at least that's how it was perceived in 
the the US G1 cartoon.

Legendary, your statement is falsch.  The Plasma Energy Chamber was not 
located in the core of the planet, just several sectors below the surface.  
Though any Cybertronian its plasma energy came in contact with it overloaded 
'em and took them down.  But you are correct, NO ORGANIC material of the 
sort.  

Moving on, how Cybertron came to be was never explained in the US G1 cartoon. 
 It may have been in the US comic, but I haven't read all of them.  Though in 
the MUSH I'm in they say it was originally just a asteroid.  So just a chunk 
of rock, NO LIFE.  I don't know if it was an asteroid for sure though.)

L. Unitron
